decisions_made.decision: Security Sentinel sits ABOVE the hub as independent layer, not inside it
decisions_made.rationale: If hub is compromised, Sentinel goes down too. Independent layer can monitor everything including the hub. Direct alert line to human bypasses hub's decision queue.

decisions_made.decision: Build order: Spoke 2 → Spoke 3 → Spoke 4 → Hub → Spoke 5 → Security → Spoke 1
decisions_made.rationale: Dev Engine is foundation for everything. Marketing next because it drives revenue. Discovery scanner is last because it requires all other spokes to be functional first.

decisions_made.decision: Use official GitHub MCP binary instead of deprecated npm package
decisions_made.rationale: @modelcontextprotocol/server-github deprecated May 2025. Official binary from github.com/github/github-mcp-server is actively maintained (v0.30.3, Feb 2026).

decisions_made.decision: Relocate Stripe/Firecrawl/PostHog/Semgrep from Spoke 2 to correct spokes
decisions_made.rationale: These tools belong to Revenue (Stripe), Discovery (Firecrawl), Hub (PostHog), Security (Semgrep) — not the Dev Engine.
alternatives_considered: Keep all in Spoke 2 as shared tools

decisions_made.decision: Hub needs 6 dedicated skills (morning-brief, kpi-dashboard, decision-queue, reinforce, product-health, signal-router)
decisions_made.rationale: Hub is cross-cutting — needs meta-level visibility across all spokes, not just per-project status.

next_immediate_step.details: Define all skills needed for Marketing & Distribution spoke: /market-strategy, /content-create, /distribute, /engage, /ab-analyze. Include tool requirements, process steps, and guard rails for each.
